t: Psalm 102
Do Not Hide Your Face from Me
A Prayer of one afflicted, when he is faint and pours out his complaint before the Lord.
Hear*pn my prayer, O Lord;*s let*ln my cry come to you!
Do*ln not hide your face from me in*ld the day of my distress! Incline*ln your ear to me; answer*ld me speedily in the day when I call!
For*pn my days pass away like smoke, and*ld my bones burn like a furnace.
My*ln heart is struck down like grass and has withered; I*ld forget to eat my bread.
Because*ln of my loud groaning my*ld bones cling to my flesh.
I*ln am like a desert owl of the wilderness, like*ld an owl of the waste places;
I*ln lie awake; I*ld am like a lonely sparrow on the housetop.
All*ln the day my enemies taunt me; those*ld who deride me use my name for a curse.
For*ln I eat ashes like bread and*ld mingle tears with my drink,
because*ln of your indignation and anger; for*ld you have taken me up and thrown me down.
My*ln days are like an evening shadow; I*ld wither away like grass.
But*pn you, O Lord,*s are enthroned forever; you*ld are remembered throughout all generations.
You*ln will arise and have pity on Zion; it*ld is the time to favor her; the*ld appointed time has come.
For*ln your servants hold her stones dear and*ld have pity on her dust.
Nations*ln will fear the name of the Lord,*s and*ld all the kings of the earth will fear your glory.
For*ln the Lord*s builds up Zion; he*ld appears in his glory;
he*ln regards the prayer of the destitute and*ld does not despise their prayer.
Let*pn this be recorded for a generation to come, so*ld that a people yet to be created may praise the Lord:*s
that*ln he looked down from his holy height; from*ld heaven the Lord*s looked at the earth,
to*ln hear the groans of the prisoners, to*ld set free those who were doomed to die,
that*ln they may declare in Zion the name of the Lord,*s and*ld in Jerusalem his praise,
when*ln peoples gather together, and*ld kingdoms, to worship the Lord.*s
He*pn has broken my strength in midcourse; he*ld has shortened my days.
“O*ln my God,” I say, “take me not away in*ld the midst of my days— you*ln whose years endure throughout*ld all generations!”
Of*pn old you laid the foundation of the earth, and*ld the heavens are the work of your hands.
They*ln will perish, but you will remain; they*ld will all wear out like a garment. You*ln will change them like a robe, and they will pass away,
but*ld you are the same, and your years have no end.
The*ln children of your servants shall dwell secure; their*ld offspring shall be established before you.
